snippet: Employers in the United States added 178,000 workers last month, while the unemployment rate dropped to its lowest level in more than nine years....
abstract: Bureau of Labor Statistics report shows Pres-elect Donald Trump will inherit healthy economy from Pres Obama, with wage growth continuing to run ahead of inflation and unemployment rate of 4.6 percent; conditions were starkly different when Obama took office, with country then in severe downward spiral; despite improvements, however, many Americans feel passed by.
lead_paragraph: Employers in the United States added 178,000 workers last month, while the unemployment rate dropped to its lowest level in more than nine years.

headline.main: President Obama Is Handing a Strong Economy to His Successor
headline.print_headline: Obama’s Gift to Successor: The Economy
